references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 2: The Aircraft

questions.question: In addition to equipment requirements stipulated in Part 91, what do Parts 125 and 135 require in terms of equipment related to navigation and communication for Air Operations?
questions.answer: Insruments and equipment to ensure that the failure of any independent system required for either navigation or communication purposes, or both, does not result in an inability to communicate and navigate safely as required for the route being flown.

questions.question: What restraints or seat belts (if any) are required for crew seats for aircraft being flown in Air Operations?
questions.answer: An approved shoulder harness or safety belt with a diagonal shoulder strap for each crew seat.

questions.question: What aircraft equipment is required by Parts 125 and 135 for aircraft operating at night?
questions.answer: A landing light, and a light in each passenger compartment.

questions.question: For Part 135 air operations, when are each of the following required? Cockpit-voice recorder. Flight data recorder. Additional attitude indicator.
questions.answer: Cockpit-voice recorder: helicopter, where the manual requires 2 or more flight crew members, or passenger seating capacity is 10 or or more. Flight data recorder: helicopter, with certificated seating capacity of 10 seats or more excluding crew member seats. Additional attitude indicator: for turbojet or turbofan powered aircraft.

questions.question: For Part 125 air operations, when are each of the following required? Public address and crew-member intercom system. Cockpit-voice recorder. Flight data recorder. Additional attitude indicator.
questions.answer: PA and crew-member intercom: any aeroplane with a seating capacity of 10 or more, excluding pilot seating. Cockpit-voice recorder: any aeroplane whose flight manual requires 2 or more flight crew members. Flight data recorder: any multi-engine turbine powered aeroplanes (with exceptions, notably regarding MCTOW and seating less than 10 seats). Additional attitude indicator: any turbojet or turbofan aeroplanes.
